content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.12 - Limousine/van service

State Regulations
(a) General
system. Limousines and vans shall be operated from loading/unloading areas as
designated by the airport manager. Such limousines and vans under access permit
with the NFTA may load or unload only passengers whose transportation by such
vehicles has been arranged prior to such vehicle's entry onto airport property. The limousine or van service operator may cause a direct line telephone service
to be installed between its operating facility and the airport, and pay the
appropriate charges, and it may indicate the location of said telephone service
in the terminal buildings by an appropriate sign or signs. (b) Rules applicable to limousine/van
operators. (1)

Vehicle appearance and running
condition. All limousines/vans shall be kept clean and in first class running
condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising
on the airport property is prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized parking. Drivers of
limousines or van operators shall not park in areas other than public parking
areas, unless otherwise authorized by the NFTA. (4)

Solicitation. Limousine or van service
operators, or any driver or employee of such operators, shall not engage in
solicitation at the airport or in any way collaborate with or encourage any
other person to solicit business at the airport on such operator's
behalf. (5)

Improper conduct. Limousine or van drivers, starters, and employees of such operators shall not
engage in boisterous conversations, profanity, or fighting at the airport, nor
shall they provide misleading information concerning other ground
transportation services. (6)

Vehicle requirements. Each limousine and van shall at all times meet all
requirements imposed by New York State Departments of Transportation and Motor

Vehicles, in addition to all other applicable State, city and other local
ordinances. (c) Fees and
charges. As set forth in the airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of

Commissioners. Notes
